snippet: A judge ruled that the driver, Baqir Raza, violated a section of city human rights law when he drove away from a black family to pick up two white women.
abstract: Administrative law Judge Raymond E Kramer rules that taxi driver Baqir Raza's decision to not pick up Cynthia Jordan and her family in Midtown  Manhattan 2013 was motivated by racial prejudice because family is black; recommends $25,000 in fines and damages but New York City Commission on Human Rights will make final determination; case represents significant shift in city's handling of racism charges against cabdrivers.
lead_paragraph: A judge ruled that the driver, Baqir Raza, violated a section of city human rights law when he drove away from a black family to pick up two white women.
